entry.title: Lighthouse
entry.summary:
Author: KilldevilandtheWildThings

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 118,156Chapters: 22/28Kudos: 857

Summary: Buck had lost-- he was sure of this now. His resolve only lasted a few weeks before his exterior began to crack; he was never a very good actor. He couldn’t keep up the greetings and the asking questions and the easy stroll. He let his shoulders creep up to his ears, let his foot tap incessantly. He did what his Captain told him, but stopped asking for anything more. Stopped following the conversation in the back of the engine on the way to the call; he just stared out the window, thinking about the case to come, preparing for it. When he woke every morning, there was no big recovery milestone to strive for, no big fight for the soul of his career to win. Not even the happy swell of being back on shift -- something so easy to dismiss, that had dominated so much of his life, that he had taken for granted-- that had catalyzed him each morning of his first week back.An old habit of his had returned. A bad habit.~~or: after the lawsuit, buck confronts what it was he wanted all along. he looks and looks and longs for it; the team look right through him. buck breaks-- right down the middle.

Summary: “What the fuck is this?” Eddie made a face bending back down to pick the ball back up and examine the fluid that was bucks cum still inside the little crevice. “Is this. Is this. Cum?” eddie said in disbelief and disgust looking up at him and then back at the ball and back at him again he most likely had a very guilty look on his face. He could feel his cheeks warm in embarrassment, “did. Did you. Did you cum onto my basketball.” eddie asked still wearing a confused and slightly disgusted look on his face.And buck panicked “ who? Me? No of course not why would i do that” he scoffed then shoved his hands in his pockets trying to look innocent. Which he doesn't think worked very well.Because Eddie's face twisted even more. “Buck what the fuck why would you do that?”“Why do you assume it was me? Why would I do that? Thats crazy” “I don't know because who else is gonna cum into my basketball. Because it sure as hell wasn't me. And its not like I don't have many visitors. Unless I happen to have a very horny ghost. Who else could it be?”“I mean it could have been a ghost.”“Buck!” Eddie shouted looking at him with those big eyes--or the one with the basketball.

entry.title: I’ll hold you and I’ll be home
entry.summary:
Author: That_aquarius_girl

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 23,491Chapters: 12/12Kudos: 80

Summary: It’s dark as he makes his way back to the truck. Before he gets in he hears a crash from somewhere behind him. As he turns to see what happened he’s hit with a hard whack on the back of his head. Before he knows it he’s on the ground, warm blood running down his face from the head wound. He tries to get up, tries to defend himself but there’s a pounding in his head making it hard to function. As he pushes up on his hands he feels a shove on his back as he slams back into the ground. Whoever’s doing this isn’t going to let him get away.He looks up to try and identify the attacker but his vision has gone blurry and there’s blood leaking into his eyes.“Honestly Eddie I thought you were going to make this much harder for me. entry.title: In action, in apprehension
entry.summary:
Author: cathcer1984

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 17,311Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 102

Summary: This time they meet in the middle, arms curling around each other. Eddie lets himself take the joy in this moment. He's the one that tucks his face into Buck's neck, closing his eyes and breathing him in. It's a strange feeling to have a part of him healing with the embrace while another cracks wide open. Buck holds onto him tightly. "I missed you," he whispers into Eddie's hair. Blinking his eyes open, Eddie tries to shoo away the happy, relieved tears that spring up. Only he catches sight of Chris in the doorway watching them. His back is turned towards the light so most of his expression is in shadow but Eddie can make out the frown. It's like a bucket of ice water on him. ---Eddie and Chris come back from El Paso. Eddie is ready to embrace joy, and joy is Buck. Only there are obstacles, Chris being one of them.

entry.title: Reborn in flames
entry.summary:
Author: starkoondy

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 440Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 1

Summary: Buck had always been a free spirit, always running —from the memories, from the pain, from everything he lost that night—. He traveled from place to place, searching for answers that never came, until he decided to return and follow in his adoptive father’s footsteps. Becoming a firefighter seemed like the only thing that made sense. Then came Eddie: strong, complicated, and surprisingly easy to love. Neither of them saw it coming, but maybe, for the first time, Buck found a reason to stay.

He’s never seen a truck jackknife in person. entry.title: What We Leave Behind
entry.summary:
Author: le_medusa

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,199Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 8

Summary: Eddie is in the process of selling his house in Los Angeles before moving to El Paso with Christopher. During a visit from potential buyers, Buck unexpectedly shows up wearing his famous pink cardigan. One of the buyers, Alex, seems a little too interested in Buck, making Eddie visibly uncomfortable and jealous—though he denies it. Buck, always perceptive, teases him about his reaction.Two weeks later, Eddie and Buck stand in front of the house, now officially Buck’s. Before leaving, Eddie promises Buck that he will always answer his calls and messages, no matter the time or distance. Buck, though skeptical, accepts the promise. Finally, Eddie gets into his truck and drives away, leaving his home behind but knowing that a part of him will always remain in Los Angeles.

Summary: Evan “Buck” Buckley MAR. 4th 11:03:13 AM “Do I really have to talk right now? Fine, Maddie, if you are watching, I’m sorry if you saw what happened yesterday; feel free not to consider me a brother anymore. As for my friends at 118, please tell me you didn’t see that. I begged you not to watch! By the way, you guys see all of the footage, right? Could you tell me who left the water on my nightstand? You can’t or won’t because I can see in your eyes that you know who I should thank to...” Edmundo “Eddie” Diaz MAR. 4th 11:13:41 AM “How could I leave him alone? I tried to put him in his bed, but he kept pushing me away, calling me Bobby and Cap. In the end, I stopped trying and let him sleep on the floor. If not for the smell of alcohol, he would remind me of my son when he refuses to go to sleep. Please, don’t tell him that I left the glass of water on his nightstand. I know that he doesn’t like me for who knows what reason, but it felt wrong to leave him when the girl he spent the night with did. They what?!”-The relationship between Buck and Eddie didn't start Amazingly, but in the end, they realized that they were a Perfect Match.

entry.title: the crashout
entry.summary:
Author: mcwriting

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,393Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 375

Summary: Buck was fine.No really, he was.At least, that's what Eddie could tell from their constant stream of communication in the 3 weeks since he’d returned to Texas.Text updates all the time, facetimes at least a couple times a week, even sending each other Instagram reels when they took the time to scroll social media in the evenings (“that’s so cringe, dad” Christopher had said. Apparently reels were way behind trend compared to TikTok and unfortunately Eddie was 0-2 in that argument because Buck voiced the same sentiment).But really and truly, they were fine. Both of them.Fine.Until they weren’t.It had been 3 weeks and 4 days since Eddie moved (really, who’s counting?), and he hopped onto facetime with Buck after dinner.“What the hell is that?” were the first words out of Eddie’s mouth. Oops.—Aka Eddie's in Texas, Buck gets a crisis haircut, and Eddie has a conniption over it. And somehow it's all Joe Burrow's fault.Now featuring Buck's perspective!
